channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Learning to Detect Multi-class Anomalies with Just One Normal Image Prompt
item.description: However, these self-attention reconstruction models primarily operate on target features, which may result in perfect reconstruction for both normal and anomaly features due to high consistency with context, leading to failure in detecting anomalies.

item.title: Train a Multi-Task Diffusion Policy on RLBench-18 in One Day with One GPU
item.description: We present a method for training multi-task vision-language robotic diffusion policies that reduces training time and memory usage by an order of magnitude.

item.title: Layered Unlearning for Adversarial Relearning
item.description: Our goal is to understand how post-training methods, such as fine-tuning, alignment, and unlearning, modify language model behavior and representations.

item.title: ARCANE -- Early Detection of Interplanetary Coronal Mass Ejections
item.description: Interplanetary coronal mass ejections (ICMEs) are major drivers of space weather disturbances, posing risks to both technological infrastructure and human activities.

item.title: MetaUAS: Universal Anomaly Segmentation with One-Prompt Meta-Learning
item.description: This paradigm enables us to leverage large-scale synthetic image pairs, featuring object-level and local region changes, derived from existing image datasets, which are independent of target anomaly datasets.

item.title: MAKE: Multi-Aspect Knowledge-Enhanced Vision-Language Pretraining for Zero-shot Dermatological Assessment
item.description: Dermatological diagnosis represents a complex multimodal challenge that requires integrating visual features with specialized clinical knowledge.

item.title: Spec2VolCAMU-Net: A Spectrogram-to-Volume Model for EEG-to-fMRI Reconstruction based on Multi-directional Time-Frequency Convolutional Attention Encoder and Vision-Mamba U-Net
item.description: High-resolution functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) is essential for mapping human brain activity; however, it remains costly and logistically challenging.

item.title: Predicting butterfly species presence from satellite imagery using soft contrastive regularisation
item.description: The growing demand for scalable biodiversity monitoring methods has fuelled interest in remote sensing data, due to its widespread availability and extensive coverage.

item.title: APR-Transformer: Initial Pose Estimation for Localization in Complex Environments through Absolute Pose Regression
item.description: Precise initialization plays a critical role in the performance of localization algorithms, especially in the context of robotics, autonomous driving, and computer vision.

item.title: Marigold: Affordable Adaptation of Diffusion-Based Image Generators for Image Analysis
item.description: The success of deep learning in computer vision over the past decade has hinged on large labeled datasets and strong pretrained models.

item.title: TopoDiT-3D: Topology-Aware Diffusion Transformer with Bottleneck Structure for 3D Point Cloud Generation
item.description: To address this limitation, we propose TopoDiT-3D, a Topology-Aware Diffusion Transformer with a bottleneck structure for 3D point cloud generation.

item.title: Efficient Mixed Precision Quantization in Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Mixed precision quantization emerges as a promising solution to enhance the efficiency of GNN architectures without compromising prediction performance.

item.title: SAD Neural Networks: Divergent Gradient Flows and Asymptotic Optimality via o-minimal Structures
item.description: We prove that the gradient flow either converges to a critical point or diverges to infinity while the loss converges to an asymptotic critical value.

item.title: Sparse Point Cloud Patches Rendering via Splitting 2D Gaussians
item.description: Hence, we introduce a novel point cloud rendering method by predicting 2D Gaussians from point clouds.

item.title: Online Isolation Forest
item.description: The anomaly detection literature is abundant with offline methods, which require repeated access to data in memory, and impose impractical assumptions when applied to a streaming context.

item.title: Scalable Computations for Generalized Mixed Effects Models with Crossed Random Effects Using Krylov Subspace Methods
item.description: Mixed effects models are widely used for modeling data with hierarchically grouped structures and high-cardinality categorical predictor variables.

item.title: BLIP3-o: A Family of Fully Open Unified Multimodal Models-Architecture, Training and Dataset
item.description: Building on our innovative model design, training recipe, and datasets, we develop BLIP3-o, a suite of state-of-the-art unified multimodal models.

item.title: OpenLKA: An Open Dataset of Lane Keeping Assist from Recent Car Models under Real-world Driving Conditions
item.description: Lane Keeping Assist (LKA) is widely adopted in modern vehicles, yet its real-world performance remains underexplored due to proprietary systems and limited data access.

item.title: Variational Prefix Tuning for Diverse and Accurate Code Summarization Using Pre-trained Language Models
item.description: Recent advancements in source code summarization have leveraged transformer-based pre-trained models, including Large Language Models of Code (LLMCs), to automate and improve the generation of code summaries.

item.title: AdaFortiTran: An Adaptive Transformer Model for Robust OFDM Channel Estimation
item.description: Deep learning models for channel estimation in Orthogonal Frequency Division Multiplexing (OFDM) systems often suffer from performance degradation under fast-fading channels and low-SNR scenarios.

item.title: EDBench: Large-Scale Electron Density Data for Molecular Modeling
item.description: Existing molecular machine learning force fields (MLFFs) generally focus on the learning of atoms, molecules, and simple quantum chemical properties (such as energy and force), but ignore the importance of electron density (ED) $\rho(r)$ in accurately understanding molecular force fields (MFFs).

item.title: Ranking-Based At-Risk Student Prediction Using Federated Learning and Differential Features
item.description: Such textbooks yield learning log data that have been used in numerous educational data mining (EDM) studies for student behavior analysis and performance prediction.

item.title: FACTors: A New Dataset for Studying the Fact-checking Ecosystem
item.description: It contains 118, 112 claims from 117, 993 fact-checking reports in English (co-)authored by 1, 953 individuals and published during the period of 1995-2025 by 39 fact-checking organisations that are active signatories of the IFCN (International Fact-Checking Network) and/or EFCSN (European Fact-Checking Standards Network).

item.title: Atomic Consistency Preference Optimization for Long-Form Question Answering
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) frequently produce factoid hallucinations - plausible yet incorrect answers.

item.title: Focus, Merge, Rank: Improved Question Answering Based on Semi-structured Knowledge Bases
item.description: In many real-world settings, machine learning models and interactive systems have access to both structured knowledge, e. g., knowledge graphs or tables, and unstructured content, e. g., natural language documents.

item.title: CXMArena: Unified Dataset to benchmark performance in realistic CXM Scenarios
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) hold immense potential for revolutionizing Customer Experience Management (CXM), particularly in contact center operations.

item.title: UMotion: Uncertainty-driven Human Motion Estimation from Inertial and Ultra-wideband Units
item.description: Sparse wearable inertial measurement units (IMUs) have gained popularity for estimating 3D human motion.

item.title: WavReward: Spoken Dialogue Models With Generalist Reward Evaluators
item.description: To address this gap, we propose WavReward, a reward feedback model based on audio language models that can evaluate both the IQ and EQ of spoken dialogue systems with speech input.

item.title: Evaluating the Robustness of Adversarial Defenses in Malware Detection Systems
item.description: Adversarially trained defenses, including AT-rFGSM-k, AT-MaxMA, improves robustness under small budgets but remains vulnerable to unrestricted perturbations, with attack success rates of 99. 45% and 96. 62%, respectively.

item.title: Few-Shot Anomaly-Driven Generation for Anomaly Classification and Segmentation
item.description: The experiments demonstrate that our generated anomalies effectively improve the model performance of both anomaly classification and segmentation tasks simultaneously, \eg, DRAEM and DseTSeg achieved a 5. 8\% and 1. 5\% improvement in AU-PR metric on segmentation task, respectively.

item.title: DRRNet: Macro-Micro Feature Fusion and Dual Reverse Refinement for Camouflaged Object Detection
item.description: In the decoder, we also introduce a reverse refinement module that leverages spatial edge priors and frequency-domain noise suppression to perform a two-stage inverse refinement of the output.

item.title: Toward Fair Federated Learning under Demographic Disparities and Data Imbalance
item.description: Ensuring fairness is critical when applying artificial intelligence to high-stakes domains such as healthcare, where predictive models trained on imbalanced and demographically skewed data risk exacerbating existing disparities.

item.title: Distance-aware Self-adaptive Graph Convolution for Fine-grained Hierarchical Recommendation
item.description: Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs) are widely used to improve recommendation accuracy and performance by effectively learning the representations of user and item nodes.

item.title: Stable and Convexified Information Bottleneck Optimization via Symbolic Continuation and Entropy-Regularized Trajectories
item.description: The Information Bottleneck (IB) method frequently suffers from unstable optimization, characterized by abrupt representation shifts near critical points of the IB trade-off parameter, beta.

item.title: MUST: Multi-Scale Structural-Temporal Link Prediction Model for UAV Ad Hoc Networks
item.description: In adversarial environments where the route information of UAVs is unavailable, predicting future links must rely solely on the observed historical topological information of UANETs.

item.title: Conformal Bounds on Full-Reference Image Quality for Imaging Inverse Problems
item.description: In imaging inverse problems, we would like to know how close the recovered image is to the true image in terms of full-reference image quality (FRIQ) metrics like PSNR, SSIM, LPIPS, etc.

item.title: Zero-Shot Multi-modal Large Language Model v.s. Supervised Deep Learning: A Comparative Study on CT-Based Intracranial Hemorrhage Subtyping
item.description: This study evaluates the performance of zero-shot multi-modal large language models (MLLMs) compared to traditional deep learning methods in ICH binary classification and subtyping.

item.title: On the Learning with Augmented Class via Forests
item.description: In this work, we focus on learning with augmented class via forests, where an augmented class may appear in testing data yet not in training data.

item.title: Reproducibility Study of "Cooperate or Collapse: Emergence of Sustainable Cooperation in a Society of LLM Agents"
item.description: This study evaluates and extends the findings made by Piatti et al., who introduced GovSim, a simulation framework designed to assess the cooperative decision-making capabilities of large language models (LLMs) in resource-sharing scenarios.

item.title: Contactless Cardiac Pulse Monitoring Using Event Cameras
item.description: An end-to-end model is trained to extract the cardiac signal from a two-dimensional representation of the event stream, with model performance evaluated based on the accuracy of the calculated heart rate.

item.title: SHAP-based Explanations are Sensitive to Feature Representation
item.description: This paper examines the impact of data engineering choices on local feature-based explanations.

item.title: A Social Robot with Inner Speech for Dietary Guidance
item.description: We explore the use of inner speech as a mechanism to enhance transparency and trust in social robots for dietary advice.

item.title: Skeleton-Guided Diffusion Model for Accurate Foot X-ray Synthesis in Hallux Valgus Diagnosis
item.description: Medical image synthesis plays a crucial role in providing anatomically accurate images for diagnosis and treatment.

item.title: Judging the Judges: Can Large Vision-Language Models Fairly Evaluate Chart Comprehension and Reasoning?
item.description: While using LVLMs as judges to assess the chart comprehension capabilities of other LVLMs could streamline evaluation processes, challenges like proprietary datasets, restricted access to powerful models, and evaluation costs hinder their adoption in industrial settings.

item.title: A Large-Scale Empirical Analysis of Custom GPTs' Vulnerabilities in the OpenAI Ecosystem
item.description: In this study, we analyze 14, 904 custom GPTs to assess their susceptibility to seven exploitable threats, such as roleplay-based attacks, system prompt leakage, phishing content generation, and malicious code synthesis, across various categories and popularity tiers within the OpenAI marketplace.

item.title: ReSurgSAM2: Referring Segment Anything in Surgical Video via Credible Long-term Tracking
item.description: In this paper, we introduce ReSurgSAM2, a two-stage surgical referring segmentation framework that leverages Segment Anything Model 2 to perform text-referred target detection, followed by tracking with reliable initial frame identification and diversity-driven long-term memory.

item.title: Achieving Scalable Robot Autonomy via neurosymbolic planning using lightweight local LLM
item.description: PDDL-based symbolic task planning remains pivotal for robot autonomy yet struggles with dynamic human-robot collaboration due to scalability, re-planning demands, and delayed plan availability.

item.title: Rejoining fragmented ancient bamboo slips with physics-driven deep learning
item.description: This approach enables the training of a matching network without requiring manually paired samples, providing ranked suggestions to facilitate the rejoining process.

item.title: Large Language Model Psychometrics: A Systematic Review of Evaluation, Validation, and Enhancement
item.description: The rapid advancement of large language models (LLMs) has outpaced traditional evaluation methodologies.

item.title: BAT: Benchmark for Auto-bidding Task
item.description: The optimization of bidding strategies for online advertising slot auctions presents a critical challenge across numerous digital marketplaces.
